DOC.brief_summary: This study aim adapt implement district-led , policy-based , low cost Maternal Newborn Health ( MNH ) intervention package use MamaToto process , proven successful Uganda , rural Tanzania . The investigator hypothesize 'MamaToto Package ' successfully implement Misungwi District effective improve key maternal newborn health indicator study participant .
DOC.detailed_description: This study collect baseline data indicator relate pre-natal care , delivery , post-natal care , treatment childhood illness family planning . Data collection tools/strategies include 1 ) mapping exercise , 2 ) health facility audit 3 ) household survey 4 ) exit interview . Data collect baseline endline . Operational data collect throughout life study . Results use inform implementation intervention aim improve health facility capacity deliver good quality care woman child strengthen family community well advocate engage activity promote healthy woman child . Mapping data collect two district 1 ) Misungwi 2 ) Kwimba . Baseline endline data collect Misungwi The intervention begin Misungwi Yrs 1 2 roll Kwimba YR 3 .
DOC.criteria: All household live select village competent participant great 15 year age All woman reproductive age ( age 1549 year old ) living household Households participants away extended time one home time survey completion
